title: How to Create Site Assessment Checklists
description: Use consistent checklists for site visits so you never miss details and give accurate quotes.
requirements: Knowledge of what you check during site visits
A smartphone or clipboard for using the checklist

steps.title: List what you check on site visits
substeps: What do you look at first?
What measurements do you take?
What questions do you ask the customer?
What factors affect your pricing?
What photos do you take?
steps.tip: Think about a time you missed something. Add that to the list.

steps.title: Use ChatGPT to organize it
steps.description: Turn your notes into a proper checklist.
substeps: Go to chat.openai.com

Type: 'Create a site assessment checklist for a [your trade] business. Include sections for: property info, measurements, condition assessment, photo documentation, customer questions, and pricing factors.'
Review and add your specific items

steps.title: Add your pricing factors
steps.description: Include everything that affects your quote.
substeps: Access: Is it easy to get equipment in?
Complexity: Standard job or complications?
Materials: What type/grade will you use?
Condition: Any prep work needed?
Timeline: Rush job or flexible?

steps.title: Make it mobile-friendly
steps.description: You'll use this in the field.
substeps: Option 1: Google Docs on your phone
Option 2: Notion or a notes app
Option 3: Print copies on a clipboard
Option 4: Use your CRM's built-in forms (Jobber, HouseCall Pro)
steps.tip: Digital beats paper — you can attach photos directly.

steps.title: Use it consistently
steps.description: A checklist only works if you use it every time.
substeps: Pull up the checklist before every site visit
Go through every item — even if it seems obvious
Take photos as you go
Note anything unusual for follow-up

successMessage: You have a professional site assessment checklist! Consistent assessments = accurate quotes = fewer surprises.
proTips: Keep refining your checklist. When you miss something, add it.
Create different checklists for different job types
Share checklists with helpers so they assess jobs the same way
